article.title: Raytheon Ship Self Defense Contract Modified
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: Raytheon Company, Integrated Defense Systems, San Diego, California, is being awarded a $7,228,070 cost-plus-fixed-fee, cost-plus-award-fee modification to previously awarded contract to exercise options for fiscal 2012 Ship Self Defense System (SSDS) platform systems engineering agent efforts. SSDS is a combat system that integrates and coordinates all of the existing sensors and weapon systems onboard ships. Naval Sea Systems Command, Washington, D.C., is the contracting activity.
